page.title: 07LOWICK MANOR FARM.
page.content: This is part of the Drayton Estate. It covers 1300 acres. The land is limestone, clay and ironstone. Main crops are wheat barley and oilseed rape. barley is grown for fodder as well as for marketing. Some straw is burned but some is baled for feed and bedding. Hay is also produced. The Estate has its own Tractors combine-harvesters and balers. No equipment is hired from other farms and none is hired out as there is plenty of work for them on the whole Estate. The farm has a house at which the manager lives. This farm has its own herdsman and shepherd as well as other workers.
